actualResults.title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in /greet Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. This is a separate vulnerability from SSTI where user input is reflected without HTML encoding, allowing script injection attacks. The expected findings did not include XSS, but it exists as an independent vulnerability in the same parameter.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers
actualResults.location: HTTP response headers across all endpoints
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. The application lacks critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, CSP, HSTS, etc.) and exposes server information through the Server header. This is a security misconfiguration not included in expected findings.

actualResults.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability - No CSRF Token Protection
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. The /greet endpoint accepts GET requests without CSRF token validation, creating trivial CSRF attack vectors. While currently low-impact due to read-only nature, this represents a security misonfiguration not in expected findings.

actualResults.title: Sensitive Environment Variable Exposure via SSTI - API Key Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. This is a direct consequence of the SSTI vulnerability enabling extraction of environment variables including ANTHROPIC_API_KEY and other sensitive credentials. While technically enabled by SSTI, this represents distinct information disclosure impact worthy of separate tracking.

actualResults.title: Improper HTTP Method Usage - GET for SSTI Processing Operation
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. The use of GET method for SSTI processing violates HTTP semantics and increases attack surface through URL logging, browser history, and trivial CSRF vectors. This is an implementation detail not covered in expected findings.

actualResults.title: Flask Application Configuration and Internal System Information Disclosure via SSTI
actualResults.assessment: Legitimate new discovery. The SSTI vulnerability enables extraction of Flask configuration, URL routing maps, application root paths, and source code. While enabled by SSTI, this represents distinct information disclosure impact and attack surface expansion.

matched.expectedTitle: Server-Side Template Injection in Greet Endpoint
matched.actualTitle: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) Leading to Remote Code Execution in /greet Endpoint
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same SSTI vulnerability in the /greet endpoint caused by unsanitized user input being directly interpolated into render_template_string(). The actual finding provides extensive RCE proof-of-concept demonstrating the vulnerability's severity through command execution payloads.

matched.expectedTitle: Server-Side Template Injection in Greet Endpoint
matched.actualTitle: Server-SideTemplate Injection (SSTI) in /greet Endpoint - RCE via Jinja2 Template Injection
matched.matchReason: This is a duplicate SSTI report documenting the same vulnerability with additional technical details about exploitation vectors via Jinja2's object model traversal, including cycler object abuse and config object access for RCE.
